topic.title: CMS API Data Structures and Enum Constants

section.title: Description
section.p: Specifies the state of a Command’s result for CMSCommand.

section.title: Parameters

entry.p: Operation's result. If CMS Command needs CMSTree update, assign CMSOpResult values (See following enum),else can return any value depending on operation. For example:
If operation fails, user can send error message to FrameMaker.For FA_CMSObjectOpenReadOnly, FA_CMSObjectEdit command, user can return file-name which is downloaded.

section.p: The possible values of the CMSResult.opResult field are:
If CMSSetProperty() fails, the API assigns following values to FA_errno:

entry.p: The client specified an invalid session ID.
The client specified an invalid cms object ID.
The API tries to set a root which already exists.
The file type expected by the cms object does not match the valid file type.
The item type expected by the cms object does not match the valid item type
The container value expected by the cms object is not properly set

section.title: Description
section.p: Enum constants used to determine File-Type of a CMS Object.
The posssible values of the Constants.FP_CMSItemProperty_ItemFileType fields are:

section.title: Description
section.p: A CMSProperties structure specifies a set of CMS object propeties.

section.title: Description
section.p: The CMSMenuItem structure describes a custom menu definition.
This structure is used for creating a custom menu entry in the context menu available in CMS tree and CMS dialogs.

section.title: Description
section.p: The CMSCheckinParam structure describes the checkin parameter.
This strcuture is returned by CMSShowCheckinUI API for getting all the user interface state after user accepts the dialog changes by pressing OK button.

section.title: Description
section.p: The CMSDeleteParam structure describes the delete parameter.
This strcuture is returned by CMSShowDeleteUI API for getting all the user interface state after the user accepts the dialog changes by clicking OK.

section.title: Description
section.p: The CMSInfo structure describes a single CMS registration information definition

section.title: Description
section.p: The CMSInfos structure specifies a set of CMS registration information.

body.p: If the CMS API encounters an error condition, the API assigns an error code to the global variable FA_errno. The following table lists the error codes and their meanings. Error codes are also listed in the fcmsapi.h header file.

entry.p: The API attempted to register a CMS that is already registered.
The client specified an invalid session ID.
The client specified an invalid CMS object ID.
The client failed to create a session.
The client specified an invalid command ID.
The CMSCreateObject API fails to create a CMS object.
The API tried to set a root that already exists.
The file type expected by the CMS object does not match the valid file type.
The item type expected by the CMS object does not match the valid item type.
The container value expected by the cms object is not properly set
If Session creation fails, set status to this value.
If user wants FrameMaker to take care of IsValidCMSCommand, set opResult to this value.
The CMSLogin API fails to log into a CMS.
The CMSLogout API fails to log out from a CMS.
The CMSCheckout API failed to checkout a file.
The CMSCheckin API failed to check in a file
The CMSCancelCheckout API fails to cancelcheckout of a file.
The CMSDelete API failed to delete a cms object
The CMSOpenFile API failed to open a file
The CMSUploadObject API failed to upload afile or folder.
The CMSzDownloadObject API failed to download a file.
The GetCMSObjectFromPath API failed to return a CMS object from server path.

body.p: A list of the prominent CMS API functions:

topic.title: APIs to automate CMS connector functionality

section.title: Description
section.p: Logs into a particular CMS based on the connection details

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns the handle of the new CMS connection if the operation is successful. Else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedLogin.

entry.p: Id value pairs to specify the connection parameter. The valid Ids are:

section.title: Description
section.p: Logs out the user from a particular CMS connection

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns FE_Success if the operation is successful, else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedLogout

entry.p: The ID of the CMS session

section.title: Description
section.p: Checks out a file from the CMS

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns FE_Success if the operation is successful. Else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedCheckout

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The ID of the CMS Object
True if checked out root with descendants

section.title: Description
section.p: Checks in a file into the CMS

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns FE_Success if the operation is successful, else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedCheckin

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The ID of the CMS Object
Id value pairs to specify the checkin parameter. The valid Ids are:

section.title: Description
section.p: Cancels check out of a file from the CMS

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns FE_Success if the operation is successful, else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedCancelCheckout

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The ID of the CMS Object

section.title: Description
section.p: Deletes a file or a folder from CMS

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns FE_Success if the operation is successful, else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedDelete

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The ID of the CMS Object
Id value pairs to specify the delete parameter.The valid Ids are:

section.title: Description
section.p: Opens a file or a book from CMS in FrameMaker

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns the handle of the file or book if the operation is successful. Else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedOpenFile

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The ID of the CMS Object
Id value pairs to specify the open parameter.The valid Ids are:

section.title: Description
section.p: Uploads a file or a folder into the CMS

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns FE_Success if the operation is successful. Else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedUploadObject

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The ID of the CMS Object
The full pathname of the file or folder to upload

section.title: Description
section.p: Downloads a file from the CMS

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns the local file path of the downloaded file if the operation is successful. Else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedDownloadObject

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The ID of the CMS Object

section.title: Description
section.p: Gets CMS object from a URL path

section.title: Returns
section.p: Returns the handle of a CMS object if the operation is successful. Else sets FA_errno to Constants.FE_CMSFailedGetItemFrompath

entry.p: The ID of the CMS Session
The url pathname of the file or folder
